title: Jane Harman
deleted: She made headlines in 1978, when she quit to spend more time with her children. She and her husband, Richard Frank divorced in 1979.<ref>{{cite news|title=Personality Glimpses|url=https://www.newspapers.com/image/980495/?terms=%22Jane%2BLakes%22%2BWhite%2BHouse |access-date=May 8, 2018|work=The Salinas Journal|date=June 2, 1978}}</ref><ref name="CongBio">{{cite web|title=HARMAN, Jane L|url=http://history.house.gov/People/Detail/14550|access-date=May 7, 2018}}</ref> In 1980, she married [[Sidney Harman]].<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Wz9OB2xLGecC&pg=PA832|title=Women in Congress, 1917-2006|date=September 26, 2018|publisher=Government Printing Office|access-date=September 26, 2018|via=Google Books|isbn=9780160767531}}</ref><ref name="StoneBook">{{cite book|last1=Stone|first1=Kurt F.|title=The Jews of Capitol Hill: A Compendium of Jewish Congressional Members|date=2010|page=518|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=ACTF56SnaykC&pg=PA518|access-date=May 8, 2018|isbn=9780810877382}}</ref> Through the 1980s, Jane Harman worked as a corporate lawyer and as a director of her husband's company, Harman International Industries.<ref name="CongBio"/>
